ng:meta.ng:title: WP NextGen, Content Player Reference Product
ng:meta.ng:author: Locomotive Team

item.title: Several Primary resources, Several Secondary resources
One Resource without pic(checking substitution to logo).
There are many beautiful cities and towns in the world. I would like to visit some of them, to see with my own eyes what I have read or heard about.
Opposite the post office there is a modern hotel. If you turn to the left, you can see a underground.

My city is old and modern at the same time. It is old because it was founded in the 11th century. At that time its streets were narrow, dark and dirty. Now my city looks modern because of its architecture. Almost all the buildings were built after the war. The streets and avenues are wide and clean.
Mark Twain, Adventures of Huckleberry Finn (1884)
Tolkien John Ronald Reuel, John Ronald Reuel Tolkien Smith of Wootton Major (1967)
Primary resources are present, Secondary resources are absent
Primary resources are absent, Secondary resources are present
2-5, In another moment down went Alice after it, never once considering how in the world she was to get out again.
1-1, Would the fall NEVER come to an end!
1-2, How funny it'll seem to come out among the people that walk with their heads downward!
3-1, And here Alice began to get rather sleepy, and went on saying to herself, in a dreamy sort of way.
1-4, Alice was not a bit hurt, and she jumped up on to her feet in a moment: she looked up, but it was all dark overhead.
3-2, She was close behind it when she turned the corner.
2-1, Alice opened the door and found that it led into a small passage, not much larger than a rat-hole.
2-2, There seemed to be no use in waiting by the little door.
6-3, She generally gave herself very good advice.
